messages.message: Hi, do we have a list of the languages we support for translation? I have a customer with some documents in Afrikaans. If its easy for us to translate this, i’d like it included in the decision criteria as it differentiates us, but don’t want to add it if it makes the POV too complex.
I think @Faisal may have guidance here from Chubb

@Lee we ran into a slightly similar use case at Chubb. We did not test Translation... instead Chubb wanted to know if we can support Handwriting from the list of languages (provided above by Charlie). We tested on a handful of them like 10 or 12 of them.
Hey @Lee -- which language you want to translate from and to what language -- that is an easy question to answer
Hey, i’m looking for Afrikaans to English.
ok -- can you check if this model is close to what Google translate does: https://huggingface.co/facebook/m2m100_418M
we can bring this model to Instabase quickly
This is by Facebook for multi-language translation
never mind -- hugging-face UI doesn't let you play with it -- I'll do a quick test to play with it but seems like it should easily be doable

@Lee - quick tests suggest that it works on basic sentences for sure.

How to test [see the three screenshots below]:
[1] Take english text -- go to translate, and get afrikano sentence
[2] Go to that model -- put the afrikano sentence and see the translated text [it picks random language]
[3] go back to google translate, take the translated sentence, and convert it back into english
It is readable (I read Afrikaans - very close to Dutch). Bit poor grammar but it is understandable. For contracts and factual questions we ask it, it should be ok.
